title: Missing TypeScript call signature of `watch` function (`undefined` as the first parameter and an object as the second)
body:
**Describe the bug**
[As per docs](https://react-hook-form.com/api#watch), `watch` should accept `undefined` as the first argument when the second one is provided, but it turns out that it's not allowed by the function's type signature.

The `undefined` from this line:
```ts
const watchAllFields = watch(undefined, { name: "", age: "" });
```
Triggers the following error:
```
No overload matches this call.
  Overload 1 of 4, '(name: string, defaultValue?: { name: string; age: string; } | undefined): { name: string; age: string; }', gave the following error.
    Argument of type 'undefined' is not assignable to parameter of type 'string'.
  Overload 2 of 4, '(names: ("name" | "age")[], defaultValues?: { name?: string | undefined; age?: number | undefined; } | undefined): { name: string; age: number; }', gave the following error.
    Argument of type 'undefined' is not assignable to parameter of type '("name" | "age")[]'.
  Overload 3 of 4, '(names: string[], defaultValues?: { name?: string | undefined; age?: number | undefined; } | undefined): { name?: string | undefined; age?: number | undefined; }', gave the following error.
    Argument of type 'undefined' is not assignable to parameter of type 'string[]'.
```
**To Reproduce**
Open the codesandbox from below and hover over `undefined` passed to `watch` function. It shows the above error.

**Codesandbox link (Required)**
https://codesandbox.io/s/ts-type-bug-watch-with-2-params-beey7?file=/src/index.tsx

**Expected behavior**
`watch` should take `undefined` as the first argument, when the second is provided.

**Desktop:**
OS: Windows
Chrome 88
react-hook-form 6.15.3
